intro: Buchanania florida var. attopeuensis, commonly known as the Attopeu Buchanania, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of northern Thailand and Laos. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant is typically found in humid, shaded forest environments at high elevations. It produces small, fleshy fruits that are an important food source for local wildlife. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
